FRBRalias.value: The North- Western Provinces And Oudh Act, 1890

p.shortTitle: The North- Western Provinces And Oudh Act, 1890

longTitle.p: An Act to provide for the better administration of the North-
Western Provinces and Oudh and to amend certain enactments in force in those Provinces and in Oudh.
WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the better administration of the territories respectively administered by the Lieutenant-
Governor of the North- Western Provinces and the Chief Commissioner of
Oudh, and for that purpose to amend certain enactments which are in force in the said Provinces and in Oudh; It is hereby enacted as follows:--

section.heading: Title. This Act may be called the North- Western Provinces and

content.p: Oudh Act, 1890.
PART
THE NORTH- WESTERN PROVINCES
THE NORTH- WESTERN PROVINCES

section.heading: This Part shall come into force on such day as the said

content.p: Lieutenant- Governor may, by notification in the Official Gazette,
direct.
Commencement of Part I.

section.heading: and 4. Commencement of Part I. Amendment of Act 19 of 1873.

content.p: Rep. by the United Provinces Land- revenue Act, 1901 (U. P. Act 3 of
And whereas it has been determined to annex the Jhansi Division,
comprising the districts of Jhansi, Jalaun and Lalatpur, to the
Allahabad Division;
And whereas the said Jhansi Division is a Schedule District under the Scheduled Districts Act, 1874 (14 of 1874);
And whereas it is expedient that the law in force in the same division should, on such annexation, be the same as the law in force in the temporarily- settled districts comprised in the Allahabad
Division, and that the said division should cease to be a Scheduled
District;
It is hereby enacted as follows:--

section.heading: Laws in force in certain districts of the Allahabad Division to apply to Jhansi.

content.p: All enactments which shall on the day when this Part comes into force be in force in the said temporarily- settled districts and not in the said Jhansi Division shall be deemed to come into force in that Division on and from the said day.
Except the Jhansi Encumbered Estates Act, 1882 (16 of

), and the Jhansi and Morar Act, 1886 , (17 of 1886), all enactments which shall on the said day be in force in the said division and not in the said temporarily- settled districts, including the Jhansi Courts Act, 1867 (18 of 1867), and Act No. 27 of 1867,
shall be deemed to be repealed on and from the said day in the said division.

section.heading: Amendment of Act 16 of 1882. Rep. by the Bundelkhand

content.p: Encumbered Estates Act, 1903 (U. P. Act 1 of 1903).

section.heading: Discharge of functions assigned to Deputy Commissioner and

content.p: Commissioner by Act 17 of 1886. The functions assigned to the Deputy
Commissioner and the Commissioner by the Jhansi and Morar Act, 1886,
(17 of 1886), shall be discharged by the District Judge and the
High Court, respectively, and references to Courts in the Jhansi district subordinate to the Commissioner shall be deemed to apply to the Civil Courts established in that district under the Bengal,
North- Western Provinces and Assam Civil Courts Act, 1887 (12 of

section.heading: Jhansi Division to cease to be a Scheduled District.

content.p: On and from the said day the said division shall cease to be a

section.heading: Application of Act 12 of 1887 to Jhansi, and disposal of pending cases.

blockList.listIntroduction: All cases or proceedings pending in any Civil Court in the said division on the said day shall be disposed of as follows:--

item.p: if pending in the Court of a Tahsildar or of an

content.p: Assistant Commissioner of the second class-- by the

item.p: if pending in the Court of an Assistant Commissioner of the first class- by the Subordinate Judge;
if pending in the Court of a Deputy Commissioner-- by the
if pending in the Court of the Commissioner-- by the

content.p: District Judge, unless the case pending is an appeal from a decree or order of the Deputy Commissioner, in which case the appeal shall be disposed of by the High
Court.
For the purposes of sections 20 to 22, both inclusive, of the
Bengal, North- Western Provinces and Assam Civil Courts Act, 1887

blockList.listIntroduction: (12 of 1887), all decrees and orders passed by Civil Courts in the said division and not appealed against before the said day shall be deemed--

item.p: if passed by the Court of a Tahsildar or an Assistant

blockList.listIntroduction: Commissioner of the second class-- to have been passed by a Munsif;

item.p: if passed by the Court of an Assistant Commissioner of the first class-- to have been passed by a Subordinate
if passed by the Court of a Deputy Commissioner or the

content.p: Commissioner-- to have been passed by a District Judge.
Where any Civil Court ceases by reason of the passing of this

Act to have jurisdiction with respect to any case, any proceeding in relation to that case which, if that Court had not ceased to have jurisdiction, might have been had therein, may be had in the Court to which the business of the former Court is transferred by sub- section
; but this sub- section shall not apply to cases for which provision is made in section 623 or section 649 of the Code of Civil Procedure.
In the case of appeals from the decrees and orders mentioned in sub- section (3) the period of limitation shall be calculated in accordance with the provisions of section 15 of the Jhansi Courts Act,

section.heading: (18 of 1867), as though this Act had not been passed.

content.p: PART
OUDH
OUDH

section.heading: Commencement of Part II. This Part shall come into force on such day as the Chief Commissioner of Oudh may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct.
Board of Revenue of the North- Western Provinces to be the

content.p: Board of Revenue- of, and Chief Revenue- authority in, Oudh.
On and from the day on which this Part comes into force the Board of Revenue constituted under the North- Western Provinces Land- revenue Act, 1873,

(19 of 1873.) shall be deemed to be also the Board of Revenue for the territories administered by the Chief Commissioner of Oudh, and shall be known and designated as the Board of Revenue of the North-
Western Provinces and Oudh.
All references made in any enactment as amended by this Part to the Board of Revenue shall be deemed, so far as they relate to
Oudh, to refer to the said Board.
In any enactment for the time being in force in the territories administered by the Chief Commissioner of Oudh, in which the expression" Chief Revenue- authority" or" Chief Controlling

Revenue- authority" is used, the expression shall, subject to the provisions of any enactment passed after the said day, be construed, so far as the said territories are concerned, as referring to the Board of Revenue of the North- Western Provinces and Oudh.

section.heading: Pending appeals. All appeals pending when this Part comes into force from decrees or orders passed under the same Act shall be disposed of as if this Act had not been passed:

content.p: Provided that the State Government] may, by order, transfer to the District Judge any appeals then pending before the Commissioner or
Collector in cases in which the appeal will, under the Oudh Rent Act,
, (22 of 1886.) as amended by this Part, lie to the District
Judge.
PART
THE NORTH- WESTERN PROVINCES AND OUDH
THE NORTH- WESTERN PROVINCES AND OUDH

section.heading: Commencement of Part III. This part shall come into force on such day as the Lieutenant- Governor of the North- Western Provinces and Chief Commissioner of Oudh may, by notification in the Official

content.p: Gazette, direct.

section.heading: Place where the Board may sit.

content.p: Notwithstanding anything in section 128 of the Oudh Rent Act, 1886 (22 of 1886), the Board of Revenue of the North- Western Provinces and Oudh shall, for the disposal of cases under those Acts, sit in such place or places in the
North- Western Provinces or Oudh as the State Government] may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint in respect to cases under either of those Acts.
For the disposal of cases other than those referred to in sub- section (1) the said Board may, subject to the orders of the
State Government], sit in any place in the North- Western Provinces or
Oudh that the Board thinks fit.

section.heading: Amendment of section 4, Act 19 of 1873. Rep. by the United

content.p: Provinces Land- revenue Act, 1901 (U. P. Act 3 of 1901).
